supporting.text: Spider wasps are arthropods, and all arthropods in the class Arachnida (which includes spiders) and Insecta (which includes wasps) have eight and six legs respectively, but spider wasps are wasps and thus have six legs, not eight.

attacks.text: Spider wasps are arthropods, and all arthropods in the class Arachnida (which includes spiders) and Insecta (which includes wasps) have eight and six legs respectively, but spider wasps are wasps and thus have six legs, not eight.

The name 'spider wasp' could mislead people into thinking they have eight legs like spiders, which might cause confusion about their actual anatomy.
Some species of wasps may have leg abnormalities or mutations that could result in more than six legs, though this is extremely rare.
